Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: laidlec
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. The room furnishings and amenities are very outdated but I didn't plan on spending much time in the room so opted for basic accommodations. My biggest complaint (which was also my greatest fear) was the lack of room cleanliness. There were dark hairs sitting on the bathroom counter, dark flecks or crumbs when I pulled down the sheets, and a large stain on the inside of the quilt. It was also very cold in the room at night and the toilet didn't flush properly. On the bright side, the staff was very helpful and friendly. I would not stay here again and would recommend spending a little extra cash for a clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: tbonetime
Reviews.Content: Room decor was older, shower caused wet bathroom, but free coffee and muffin included, and the price is right

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Victoria F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend. A little dingy but otherwise okay or so I thought at the time. I returned home. I woke up with three bug bites on my arm. The place was infested with bedbugs which travelled in my suitcase back to my home and now my bedroom is infested. Take my advice and shell out the extra money for a clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the nicest..”
Reviews.Author: sheilar r
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Paid $59 per night. There is no parking here so we paid $15 to park off-site where we found our car with a smashed in window the next day. Bad, dirty crackhead location. Room was tiny and cramped and pretty clean. Freezing cold when we came in . Staff were nice I'll give them that..let us check in very early(8am) We were close enough to walk downtown but not to bell centre. We will pay the extra to stay at a better place next time

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: alelex
Reviews.Content: So, we stayed at this hotel for 1 week, but I left after one night. It's not the fault of the hotel, was my own mistake. It's a 2* hotel, (1?), and we paid a really cheap price, so was my own mistake to wait for a better place. Unfortunately, the bed had red spots, the shower was disgusting and the front desk agent was really.... stange? So, if you pay 30$ or less, I think is the place to be in Montreal, but if you pay more, please, go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel I will book in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: canucklite
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Hotel Viger now for two & half years. It is the BEST hotel in Montreal for the price. The customer service is extraordinary and the rooms are quite decent for the price. IDEAL location. I travel to Montreal 2-3 times a year and this is the ONLY hotel I will stay in.

Reviews.Title: “une petite peu...very small”
Reviews.Author: DGA69
Reviews.Content: this was the first time i stayed in one of these older hotels in montreal & it was different than the usual chain hotels i'm used to. the rooms are small & the furniture is old but...you can't beat the price & location. i booked through travelocity top secret for $53/night & it's only a few blocks from both downtown & old montreal. the room also comes with it's own phone with local calls, free wifi & a tv and a mini fridge. i was also lucky & got a full bathroom. if you're on a budget...this is definitely your place!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SakuraiKenichi
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very close to Old Montreal and the Station Berri UQAM ,which is the main hub station of Montreal!! The bed is not too big and not too small and the client is easy to talk. If you want to save your money and stay convenient hotel, I recommend this Hotel Viger.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- value !!”
Reviews.Author: Ilse J
Reviews.Content: Location is GREAT! Walk to old Montreal. Surrounding area no so hot! Parking off site. Breakfast a joke unless you get there early. Staff helpful and friendly. Rooms clean. Cheap and cheerful!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, old and run down but great location”
Reviews.Author: Carine-London
Reviews.Content: The hotel is run down, the breakfast room is tiny. I cannot comment on the complimentary breakfast as I left to early to have it. My room on the basement level was basic but i think it was clean. The TV is ancient. The staff was very friendly and accomodating, even when I turned up at 5am for them to look after my suitcase until I could check in.

Reviews.Title: “Room was pretty good, but the Service was amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: allowmartin
Reviews.Content: Hi, I've stayed at Hotel Viger several times because it offers a great location. We had one of the smaller rooms in the Hotel this time. However, Giully, the young lady at the front desk was very helpful and kept the rooms very clean and organized. She was great at pointing out directions and was very warm and friendly. Thanks to Hotel Viger for keeping such an excellent office staff!! -Martin

Reviews.Title: “Just Scary...please DO NOT EVER STAY HERE...These people are Crazy”
Reviews.Author: travelkid2008
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? This hotel is a sham and the people who work here are disgustingly greedy and borderline insane. We came here planning to stay here for a fun weekend trip to Montreal. When we got there some woman who claimed she did not work there but was "filling in" was manning the desk. She then proceeded to explain that something was "wrong" with the card when they ran it that morning and there were no rooms available anymore. Two questions: (1) Does anyone know of a hotel who randomly runs your card without authorization and (2) Does anyone know of a hotel who pretends there are issues with the card - neglects to inform the booking agent or the customer- and then gives away the room. There was absolutely nothing wrong with the card and the hotel simply made this up as an excuse for purposefully overbooking. Beyond this, the hotel manager yelled at both the booking agent and myself and my husband (while laughing and mocking us) for the entirety of the situation. The hotel is not clean, the location is not good at all; in fact we saw what looked like dirt and blood stains on the floor of the breakfast room. Regarding the location, I am not sure what people are basing their location preferences on but in Montreal you want to be close to St. Catherine street, Crescent Street or Latin Quarter, this hotel is pretty much in the middle of downtown where there is nothing around. The area seems deserted and pretty unsafe. The taxi driver even said not to stay there. Just please do not stay here, if you have any value on customer service, I believe that the members of TripAdvisor need to stand together and demand that we are treated with respect and not support establishments such as this one. In fact, I will be filing a formal complaint with the equivalent of the better business bureau and the hotel governing agency in Quebec, so quite frankly not sure how long this place will be around if they continue.

Reviews.Title: “Was tolerable but one employee was great”
Reviews.Author: Maria B
Reviews.Content: Hotel was below average small out dated rooms however one employee named Guilliana was great made us feel welcomed and was extremely courteous. Location was excellent but otherwise you get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and reasonably clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: prisha40
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. It aint fancy, but the location was great, within walking distance to Old Montreal. Neighborhood is a little questionable, though. Petit Dejeuner was very basic, Costco croissant, or muffin, coffee, juice, or milk. Parking was about a block from hotel, so not super convenient. It was an interesting place to stay for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Avg 2-star hotel, tiny, no elevator, old bed. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Alybruin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Viger Hotel in downtown Montreal in Aug for 2 nights. Breakfast is included but you're provided croissant, jam, and orange juice on a tray to be eaten in your room because the breakfast room is tiny. We stayed in a room with one double bed and basically, there isn't any room for anything else so could be a problem if you have large luggage. Everything is functional and fairly clean but the beddings are old and have stains on them. There's free wifi though and the location is great. We booked here because the price is relatively cheap for Montreal and the location is convenient. However, we wouldn't be staying here again and wouldn't recommend it unless you're looking for a hostel type or you're just in town to party and looking for a cheap place. Parking is $15 Canadian dollars/day. The nearest subway station is Champs de Mars, about 5 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: ruthrex
Reviews.Content: The location, price and accomodations were perfect for us. The Hotel Viger is within walking distance of the old city and the Latin Quarter. The bus and metro is nearby. The Hotel Viger provided everything we needed to enjoy 4 days in Montreal. Hotel Viger is not new but very comfortable. The management and staff were very helpful and accomodating. This is not a luxury B&B but good value for the price. Rex And Ruth

Reviews.Title: “cute and affordable”
Reviews.Author: jamdun
Reviews.Content: The good: Great location, friendly and very helpful staff, bed was very comfortable, water was always nice and warm/hot, complimentary breakfast was always fresh and tasty, modest hotel and very affordable, especially since booked last minute. Also, free internet in your room! The bad: the sheets and towels (though they were always clean) need to be updated. very old fashioned (style, tv,decoration) so if looking for a modern hotel this place is not for you The ugly: our neighbors were noisy! definitely not the fault of the hotel but they just put a damper on the quietness that we were experiencing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: lizyt
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I were at hotel Viger for 4 nights. We were treated like part of the family; the staffs were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is excellent 5 min walk from the Metro and 10 min walk to the bus station. The rooms were clean and we felt like at home. I will recommend to everyone who travels to MontrÃ©al and need an affordable place to be to look up Hotel Viger. Merci.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly cheap”
Reviews.Author: bsterner
Reviews.Content: Was entirely satisfied with this very simple hotel with small touches of comfort that made all the difference. A friend and I stayed here for a conference downtown and got a superb deal with a joint airfare and hotel stay on travelocity. The hotel overlooks the river and if you're lucky your room will open on to superb views of the beautiful old castles and mansions across the water (our best view was sitting on the toilet in the bathroom!). We had a room with two full size beds, and they literally could not have been queen size and still fit -- I was afraid the door to the room would hit the corner of one bed when I opened it for the first time. Still, there was a fridge, a TV, and reliable wireless. Breakfast each day was: black tea or coffee, orange juice, and the choice between a croissant or a chocolate chip or blueberry muffin. The muffins were gigantic and quite good, and there were several small tables in a small room off the front desk where you could sit and eat and look out onto the street. There was also a computer crammed into one corner, and things got pretty tight when three different pairs of people tried to eat at the same time one morning. Still, the man at the front desk was very nice, always said hello and goodbye, and never tried to gip us on money. The location was excellent -- it's just a few blocks from the bus and train depot, and walking distance to all of downtown and to the historic district. If you come from the YUL airport, take the 747 bus to the end of the line. It costs 7 dollars and is reasonably quick. The drivers also seem happy to announce your stop for you (I couldn't even hear the syllables in their thick Quebec accents).

Reviews.Title: “All you need is there, exept not brand new!”
Reviews.Author: LePoaite
Reviews.Content: Clean room well located. Parking is very closeby. Quiet stay: for the price, it's a very good compromise! the mattress was very comfortable: that's what's counting the most, isn't it? i will get back there on my next trip to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “good value for location”
Reviews.Author: jarrodlamar
Reviews.Content: a great little place right in the middle of everything one could want from Montreal. The Village is a few blocks up on Ste. Cath (dining and nightlife)and the Port and Olde Town is a few blocks below. straight up st hubert a ways and to the right is La Banquise, the meilleure poutine de Montreal. The free wi-fi worked well no problems and the continental breakfast is nice for a good start of the day. the only possible gripe i could have is that for a 6'3 guy, the shower/bathroom is a tight fit. both the manager and the female receptionist were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: im_not_agirl
Reviews.Content: breakfast is complimentary,love the food.the accomodation were just fine no complaint.for money wise choose this hotel & accesible to many attractions located in the heart of MONTREAL QUEBEC

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for a quick stop”
Reviews.Author: chrisede
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Montreal and needed a cheap room for a one night stop over. Found this place, and we felt the room was compact, but clean and the bathroom importantly was decent. We didn't expect great things, but were pleased with what we got and the value it represented.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, well located but kind of hit and miss for cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: KenJCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Viger two times over the course of a week. The first two nights were quite good: clean, well located, friendly staff, a modest free breakie, a good computer, etc. All for only 80 dollars. We then stayed at another B&B for a few nights and returned to the Hotel Viger for a final night before heading off to Quebec City. What a difference! Our room the second time was dirty and had a musty smell. The shower sprayed water all over the bathroom because the curtain was inadequate and the shower head had multiple leaks. The a/c was malfunctioning as well. None of this was the case during our first stay the week before. The staff is friendly, especially Helena.

Reviews.Title: “The nastiest hotel Iâ€™ve even been to.”
Reviews.Author: Rovshana
Reviews.Content: That was the nastiest hotel Iâ€™ve even been to. Terrible, dirty, stinky, disgusting place. A person at a front desk was an extremely rude and unpleasant person. First he tried to cheat on us by charging the wrong amount for 4 nights (almost $100 more). When I tried to show him the confirmation paper I had he didnâ€™t even want to look at it. He was arguing with us for about 15 min until I made him recalculate everything and showed him the right amount. He then smiled and said: â€œoh, I see, youâ€™re good in mathâ€�. Unbelievable. When we got the keys and went upstairs (oh, by the way, thereâ€™s no elevator and you have to carry your bags all the way to the third floor). The moment we entered the room we realized we donâ€™t want to stay at this awful place. Not a single night. We went downstairs to talk to the manager. Needless to say what was his reaction to that. He said there was no way that we could cancel the reservation. Unfortunately we were charged for all 4 nights already and there was no chance that he could help us to solve the problem and get out of that place. We had to call booking.com and they helped us to cancel the reservation. We paid the cancellation fee, took our bags and run away from that place in the middle of the night. I would never never recommend that place to anyone. Donâ€™t be fooled by pictures on websites and brochures and stay away from that hotel and those people!

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: niftycat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending an academic conference. I paid less than 1/3 of the price of the conference hotels and got a single room plus continental breakfast (not included at the other hotels). Breakfast is a big muffin, coffee and juice. This is not the place to choose if you want new, fashionable, luxurious accommodations, but I found the room clean and it had everything I needed. The hotel is a short walk from a metro stop and about a 10 minute walk from the Palais des Congres. It is a 10-20 minute walk to the Old City and to other parts of downtown. The manager was friendly and very helpful. I was very happy with my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel manager himself doesn't think this is a hotel. Best advice: stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Travelfunsies
Reviews.Content: My experience was quite bad. First of all, the window in my room leaked a lot. I turned the heater on high and the room temperature wouldn't still rise above 61F. Also, since the window was so thin (and a part of it was replaced by wood) you could also hear the noise from the street very loudly. The lock in the door was also ridiculous - the safety lock had been ripped away and the lock itself wouldn't lock. I noticed it when I tried to access my room and I didn't even need a key - the door wasn't locked (and I wasn't able to lock it from the outside no matter how much I tried)... As far as I understand, the hotel is run by an Indian person. He tries really hard to be friendly and all, but doesn't really have money to run the place. Also, sometimes the customer service fails... e.g. when I asked him if there is an elevator in the hotel, he replied in a loud voice: "No we don't, this is not a hotel!!!" I couldn't agree more.

Reviews.Title: “Keep on going........right no by”
Reviews.Author: mancouver
Reviews.Content: Dumpy. Watch their recession fight web ad...rooms starting at 47 hah. Began with a very argumentative desk person. Basement room, tiny and better could be found near by. IN short: its bad!!

Reviews.Title: “Have been staying there for 15 years”
Reviews.Author: Giselle74
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Hotel Viger about 6 times in the last 15 years. It is a good budget option. The staff have always been friendly. It's located in a great location near a fun part of St. Catherine street, and walking distance to pretty much anywhere. The rooms vary, some are quite small but the doubles are roomy. It's a no-frills place to stay for a short time, and I've never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jk1984
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in Montreal for 3 days and we found the hotel to be perfect, at least for us. Of course, if u r expecting 5 stars, u won't get it. Our expectations are: safety (e.g. theft), good/perfect location, friendly/helpful staff, affordable, clean & not noisy room. This hotel gets an a+ from us for all of the above.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell ... the service is the worst I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: missmiaw
Reviews.Content: I needed to change my booking by 1 day, I contacted them by phone and email numerous time within a month of my arrival, and no one called / emailed me back. When I fianally got a hold of someone, they said that I lied, that I never did called / emailed to advised them of my change request. What a load of bull[--]. i immediatly requested to speak to the manager, was transfered, left a vm and never was contacted again.... I finally was able to change my reservation, but was charged 50% of the cost anyways WTF I stayed there since I could not get a refund, the room served it's purpose "to sleep", and when I left, I was sold a airport bus shuttle ticket at $30. Got to the bus, hopped on and was told my ticket was invalid, that I had to by another one. I would never recommend hotel viger, and will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic beds”
Reviews.Author: franco003
Reviews.Content: For over 20 years we've stayed at this charming, century-old inn. Clean, comfortable (fantastic beds-most comfortable of any place we've ever stayed). The location is very handy-between 2 Metro stops and a 10 minute walk to the Old Port or to St. Catherine St. very reasonable, seasonal rates, including breakfast (croissants or muffin, coffee, tea or chocolate and OJ). Free internet access in the lounge and parking is available for a fee. Wonderful, personal service.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Customer service!”
Reviews.Author: montrealtraveler_9
Reviews.Content: After searching through many websites dealing with various accomidations and price ranges, I found this hotel and price range to be the most easy to deal with! The price was fantastic! Check in was a breeze! Parking was at the front door! They give great old fashion service! No frills or bologna! Clean quiet accomidations. The shower in room 11..let's just say OMG! I almost forgot to add soap to the equation, best shower I have ever felt! Staff was helpfull and very nice and willing to help with getting around the city with EXACT directions. I couldn't thank them enough! They truly understand what customer service is all about!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: LozJas
Reviews.Content: This place leaves something to be desired - and that's being kind. The hallway stank of excrement, as did the room. The staff were relatively helpful but you just wouldn't want to stay there despite that. It would be fine for one night after a long evening out drinking and you didn't care about the state of the place. The bathroom was disgusting, bin wasn't emptied from previous guests. We had a room on the ground floor by the front door - the doorbell was ringing throughout the night; when someone above used water you could hear them; the same with someone moving around on the stairs. You could hear every conversation on Reception at any time, including heated family arguments in the morning. Just not good. When we checked out they did offer to change our room though.

Reviews.Title: “Best X 3 ( Best Price-Best Attention-Best Location)”
Reviews.Author: ARMANDO58
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Viger is a uncommon case of a hotel reduced price (59 $) Attention (monitor on a daily by its owner), clean, FULL equipment (air conditioning / heating, hot water, cable, refrigerator, WI-FI, Internet room, microwave, coffee / tea making facilities). Unlimited local calls and breakfast at no additional cost. Strategic location, 3 blocks from a subway station, and bus stops front to HOTEL. THE BEST-PRICE VALUE-CARE.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: merquisez
Reviews.Content: We didnt mind it the first time. But when we went back the hotel had gone downhill. Dint realize til we I got my next credit card statement, that the hotel had compromised my card. Wish I could prove it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: vegan73
Reviews.Content: At check-in, the â€œmanagerâ€� told as, rudely, to go and check to see if we liked the room. I was wondering why would he send us to take a look before checking-in, but a few minutes later I found my answer: the hallways were dirty and smelly and the room had the toilet broken. Since all hotels in Montreal were booked due to DiverscitÃ© , we only complained about the toilet. The guy was very upset and sent us to a different room in a different area of the hotel. The place was terrible! In our way to our room we saw that many rooms didn't even have a lock. There was a sofa in the "lounge" pilled up with garbage and the room had a very sticky carpet, the tv didnâ€™t work and the mattressâ€™ sheets were too small. Since I didnâ€™t want to sleep on top of a disgustingly dirty mattress, I slept with my clothes on and never ever touched the carpet except with my shoes on. Needless to say, we left the following morning. So, unless you know for sure that they have done a serious remodelling to this place, don't even consider this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “well good value but i don't wanna go there again ;-p”
Reviews.Author: adultchildren
Reviews.Content: this hotel might be the very first hotel that i won't go back again. but still, it's worth it when i consider the room rate. the room was so small. bath also like one of the dorm's. what i just liked at this hotel was i could control the temperature of my room. well i was thankful to see the cables with that cheap rate, but there was no remote control so i had to change the chanel hardly by myself. and the locations is not that bad. it's just 5 minutes walk to the bus terminal and subway station, Chateau Lamzay(?) and to the Beaux-Montreal area. for the small-budget travelers, this hotel is not that bad. also they give either one of a small croisant or a muffin for the "petit-dejourner'.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: M0rrisTraveller
Reviews.Content: We had three nights here and is was with some trepidation that we entered the hotel following some of the negative feedback we had seen on the web. First impression - tatty, but this place grows on you. The room was small double, had a great shower and a clean and comfy bed. If you are looking for a cheap option in a good location, this may be it. The Ritz it ain't but you should get a decent nights sleep at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “you pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: crazyness
Reviews.Content: Well, my boyfriend and I stayed this past long weekend at Hotel Viger, even after reading the negative reviews, which made us nervous about staying there (we already reserved a room online by the time we found the reviews, and are not the type of people to complain about the cancellation policy that we recieved in our email.) Anyways, we were quite nervous, but ended up really enjoying our stay. With the amount of money we saved we were able to do some more shopping. The negative aspects were that the walls were pretty thin, you can hear everyone opening and closing the door; there is no alarm clock, and the first morning we missed the breakfast; and the shower is horribly small and does not remain at a constant temperature. The good side was the bed was clean, the tv works, the location is great (we walked everywhere the whole weekend) and the guy at the front desk was really friendly towards us. All in all, you get what you pay for, for 30$ each per night (around 130 in total) it was good, we were only at the hotel to sleep, but if your more pickier then go with a larger chain hotel. (btw, there is a great cafe north of Viger on St. Catherines if you end up missing the breakfast like we did.)

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think that this is the best place to stay in Montreal. The first time my husband and I went before we were married we stayed there. It was a great experince. I would do it again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “I would never go back there again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to Montreal for a 3 day vacation, and we thought it would be nice to stay in a nice small private hotel not too far from Old Montreal. So we found Hotel Viger, and there's a sign outside rooms for 25$ A/C, phone and cable TV, so we thought wow that's cheap. Once I got in, the desk clerk could barely speak french or english. All I told him is that I wanted a room with 1 bed for 3 nights and he showed us this tiny room with a queen size bed in the middle. The one night stand, one little lamp, a bar fridge, a bathroom and a TV, so we thought not bad and it's quiet. So we ask how much, he says in broken english 70$/night, I ask him about the sign outside, he that's a room with no bathroom. I was able to bargain with him, by telling him I was going to somewhere else, and I finally got the price down to 45$. So I book it. I start bringing the luggage in and I notice the bar fridge isn't plugged in, no big deal. But after dinner went we got back, we found out that it was hard to find parking, the A/C barely work, the shower was leaking, the phone line was cut and there was no TV. I tried to complain to the desk clerk but he was so rude because of his broken english, that he hid in his room. The next night I got a call for a family emergency, so I went to tell the desk clerk of this information, and that I'd like a refund for my 3rd night that I paid, he refuse, telling me that he didn't know how to do a refund on a credit card, and that it's 48 hours notice he needs... TOTAL BS, because he never said this info to me, NOR is it posted in the lobby, on the back of the receipt OR in the room. All he told me is to go to the aiport and they'll give me my money back. I call the aiport the next day on my way home, and the lady told me that the airport doesn't do hotel reimbursement and that I was had by him. I would never ever recommend this hotel to anyone or any rat that may live in Montreal to stay there. I would rather sleep in a cardboard box, on St.Catherines St. before I would go there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy but room I stayed in was acommodating and clean. The service is friendly and the stay is very inexpensive, would recommend to a couple if looking for something inexpensive. Very short walk to Old Montreal, five minutes from the Cathedral.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright...good for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is worth the money paid. Had Air Conditioning, bathroom, and enough pillows, and comforters. For a group of 4, the washrooom was small...but when paying less then $60 per person for 4 nights...it's worth it!!! The breakfest is way too early...but the good thing is that a McD's is close by and most things are within walking distance....so no fretting over a Jumbo muffin and a glass of OJ (recommend going to a Timmy's or a Convienence store) Your within the Old Port area and Metro, is accessible. Your close to St. Denis and UQAM, as well as to the clubs on St. Laurent. I would come to this place again for the price i paid. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there on August 7, 2004. Generally speaking this small hotel is worth its price. The rooms are small, but clean and cozy. Staff is friendly, breakfast included juice, coffee, muffin or croissant, jam and butter. Parking is available nearby for $8 extra. Air conditioning was working well. In the summer time it's very needed since rooms are small and windows won't open. Overall, I liked the place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a GREAT price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel on this website from others before me, and became Very nervous about my decision to book one room for 4 adults during the holidays to tour the City (especially as the other couple don't do budget hotels). However, it was a small clean hotel. The only thing that stunk was the desk clerk - but I can live with that. Being that we were 2 couples sharing a room, I was very impressed that there was a wall separating the two beds for our privacy. The bathroom was clean - as were the sheets (my two priorities for any hotel). The room was really warm when we entered - but I'd rather a warm room and turn it down (and crack open the window) than a cold room. I was impressed that they still served us our continental breakfast after it was over - its only from 8-9am , but all 4 of us got orange juice and a big muffin (the Costco-sized ones) at 10am. For $20 per person per night, we definitely got our money worth and whenever I return to Montreal I will stay there - unless I want an upper-scale / romantic room... but this time I wanted a budget room. Even my picky friends were very impressed. Only complaint was that we went before New Years and there were a lot of loud partiers in the hallway after the bars closed... but I didnt voice a complaint to either the partiers or managers. Budget hotels attracted those people obviously.

Reviews.Title: “beware of the look and price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Viger the night of November 21, 2003. I had picked a brochure and it said 2 person a night 42.00 wow, we taught not bad, when i called to make reservations the man said oh! because its the week its 5.00 more, i taught alright still cheap. So we get there, wow Victorian style, yeah right! When filling out papers, the lady said oh! it will be 5.00 more dollars because of Queen size bed. Bad Advertisement! OK! its still cheap but come! When we got to the room, oh my! The bed takes up the whole room no closet, the tv is up high on a shelve with brakets, their is 2 tiny used towels, very small. So if you want to spend a nice evening with your other half, think again! If you want to get there at 10:00 spend the night and get out the next morning, not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “small nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice small Hotel close to the Metro and the Bus Station. We stay there every year.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - False advertising and rotten inside”
Reviews.Author: dienamite
Reviews.Content: BEWARE! This hotel does not have a "well preserved Antique Victorian exterior" nor is it "modern" or "clean and comfortable"! From the moment we walked into the crumbling hotel, it reeked of cat urine and had buckets placed in the hallways to catch the water that was dripping out of the ceiling. The carpeting in our room was WET and MOLDY and we wore socks the entire time. The bathroom was so small that we had to sit sideways on the toilet, and there was a HOLE in THE FLOOR! Yes, there was an A/C unit in the window but it wasn't even sealed and you could SEE the street outside! My husband called the 1-800 number to talk to me briefly and when he asked for my room #, it was transferred and the person on duty listened in and very rudely SHOUTED "GET OFF NOW!" then he hung up and came back on 30 seconds later and shouted at us "HANG UP NOW GET OFF". Unbelieveable! The "continental breakfast" is a tray of food that I wouldn't feed my dog. All we wanted was a "clean and comfortable" room - didn't think we were asking for much. We are used to staying in Motel 6 or Super 8 and I am not used to luxury at all, but this place was a DIVE and the fact that they false advertise and that the website picture does not even resemble the REAL facade!!! NEVER AGAIN!! We tried to leave 2 days early and go elsewhere but they CHARGED US UP FRONT AND REFUSED TO CREDIT MY ACCOUNT. No normal business could ever function like this - it was a total scam! When I asked for a receipt upon check-out, I had to ARGUE with the worker on duty. The "convenient" parking "across the street" is actually 3 blocks away behind a huge building and unlit. BEWARE! The only good thing about this hotel is that it is located on the edge of Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Family Tradition”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Every year we return to this basic, well placed hotel where many world travelers converge. Our kids still love it. Probably not for tourists but more for travelers like those who would love our very inexpensive Tunisian hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Accused of being a liar by the staff"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Viger for two days, Wednesday and Thursday. On that first Wednesday we asked one of the staff if we could have a late checkout on Friday at 3:00 pm. She of course said it would be no problem, just make sure we mention it to the girl at the counter the next morning. The next day (Thursday) we mentioned the late check out, to the girl with the french accent and she said it would be no problem. We went out and did our sightseeing and had a nice time. That Friday we went out to do some shopping, when we came back to drop off our bags to the room, the girl stopped us and said that we had to check out of the room, she said that they needed the room and she asked if the lady really said that we could have a late checkout. She said that the lady never said we could check out late, accusing us of lying. What would we have to gain from lying. That made us feel terrible, after we just had an enjoyable visit in Montreal. It left a bad taste in our mouth. If we could not have a late check out they could have told us that from the beginning so that we could make other arrangements. We had to pack up all of our things and take them to the car. Another sore spot was the parking, the lady (who had told us we could check out late) suddenly changed her tune. She said we had to pay the $10.00 for the parking and return the parking pass, because the man had to get paid for the parking, when clearly the parking pass was paid for the month of June. She then changed her mind and told us we could keep the parking pass until 3:00 pm if we gave her another $3.00, which we assume she quickly pocketed for herself. She offered to look after our bags until we came back but we had an uneasy feeling and we decided to put all our bags in our car. We agreed that for the price of the room, we got what we paid for, and $64.00 was not expensive, but it was misleading when the rate is advertised as much lower. It would be better if they had told us straight away what the price would be, we would gladly pay it. The room was basic, just a place to sleep and shower, although the towels could have been thicker, and a bath mat would have been nice, instead of the paper laid on the floor. If we had been treated better by the staff, we may have stayed again but we would rather pay more for a room and stay somewhere else where we would be treated as valued customers instead of criminals. - Helen

Reviews.Title: “It's definately a great stay year over”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel viger is fantastically located within the Old Port Area of Montreal close enough to all the tourist action, but not right in the middle so that it is quiet at night. I've been going to the hotel for years and have always gotten a great view of the city. Their rooms are all different sizes, but all have private washrooms. The staff, I find, is exceptional at prviding assistance and information. The best thing that I find is that the hotel is always filled with people during the summer months (I go in July) and you get to meet people form all over the Europe. The Old Port is absolutely the best during this time of year. There are thousands of tourists and tons of shows and events going on within a short walk of the hotel. They don't kid around when they tell you to book ahead. It's not the Crown Plaza, but it it's clean and quiet and safe and close to all the events.-Cathy
